key_points: 19-year-old Dillon Daniel Downey of Metamora was arraigned on charges related to the fatal shooting of a Lapeer High School student.
Downey faces one count of manslaughter without malice and one count of felony firearm.
The victim, 18-year-old Kaden James Ryan, was found with a gunshot wound to the torso and later pronounced deceased.
The incident, described as an accidental shooting, occurred in the Ideal Villa Mobile Home Park.
Metamora Township Police, led by Chief David Mallett, are conducting the investigation.
Michigan State Police Forensic Science Division and other local services responded to the scene.
Officer Cameron Plowman attempted lifesaving measures before Ryan was transported to the hospital.
Evidence from the scene is being processed by the Michigan State Police Forensic Science Division.
Kaden James Ryan was remembered in his obituary for his love for cars, video games, and making people happy.
A GoFundMe page has been set up to support Ryan's family with funeral expenses.
